wikipedia_page.main: John Jordan (born 7 February 1932) played first-class cricket for Lancashire as a lower-order batsman and wicketkeeper between 1955 and 1957. He was born at Rawtenstall, Lancashire, England.

response: *John Jordan (basketball) (c. 1910–1991), American basketball player and coach for the University of Notre Dame
*John Jordan (died c. 1422), Member of Parliament for Dorchester 1397–1414
*Sir John Jordan (diplomat) (1852–1925), British diplomat and Minister Plenipotentiary to China
*John Jordan (vintner), American vintner and Republican donor

Wilson played 171 first-class matches for Lancashire over 15 seasons, but was intermittently throughout his career superseded by other wicketkeepers who were generally better batsmen: Alfred Barlow in 1950, Frank Parr in 1953 and John Jordan in 1956. He was finally supplanted by Geoff Clayton in 1959 but returned for a single game in 1962 when he was granted a benefit to reward his loyalty.
